arts.ttl: Manchester City loanee makes revelation about Hull City future in transfer window
arts.sum: Defender Fin Burns admits he doesn't know whether or not he will still be a Hull City player after the transfer window closes on Monday week, though he says he would love to stay. Boss Selles has been hugely impressed with Burns since he took the manager's job last month, so much so he's opted against signing defensive cover in the window, with him keen to utilise Burns, who is on a season-long loan from Manchester City.

QPR are just four points away from the play-off places after beating Hull 2-1 to make it four Championship wins in a row. Here’s how we rated each Rangers player. Paul Nardi: 6 Missed a ball into his area in the second half but thankfully for Rangers so did Joe Gelhard, who later beat Nardi […] The post Hull v QPR player ratings appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Cifuentes hails QPR duo – and again demands that his players ‘keep pushing’
arts.sum: Marti Cifuentes hailed the impact of Koki Saito and Alfie Lloyd after the two substitutes played starring roles in QPR’s 2-1 win at Hull. With Rangers struggling, boss Cifuentes sent the pair on early in the second half to try to attack down the sides of the Tigers’ defence. Lloyd did exactly that to create […] The post Cifuentes hails QPR duo – and again demands that his players ‘keep pushing’ appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Hull City head coach Ruben Selles hoping for more transfer help after QPR defeat
arts.sum: Ruben Selles hopes his squad will be boosted by three more new arrivals when the Tigers face Sheffield United on Friday night, with Hull City looking to respond to Tuesday's 2-1 home loss to QPR which left them teetering a place above the Championship's drop zone. It was another opportunity where City failed to build on a couple of good results, unlike Rangers, who have gone from bottom of the league to the safety of mid-table with a fourth straight win, and just one loss in 13 games, form the Tigers could only dream of.

arts.ttl: Championship round-up: Sheffield United and Sunderland continue promotion charge as QPR win again
arts.sum: But Matt Bloomfield's Luton remain second bottom after goals from Ciaron Brown and Greg Leigh helped Oxford complete the turnaround. Strikes from Kenneth Paal and Koki Saito put the visitors in the driving seat as Joe Gelhardt's 84th-minute goal for City, his first for the club since joining from Leeds on loan, was not enough to help them mount a fightback.

arts.ttl: Late Joe Gelhardt strike not enough as Hull City beaten by in-form QPR
arts.sum: Rangers fashioned the first chance inside four minutes when Ilias Chair skipped past Sean McLoughlin on the left side of City's box, he slipped, and the lively number 10 tried to catch out Carl Rushworth at his near post, but he turned it over. City created enough in what was a low-key game but again failed to take their moments and were punished after a succession of ricochets, which fell kindly to Kenneth Paal to turn in from close range, before the points were made safe six minutes later to seal a fourth straight win for Rangers and deepen the Tigers' relegation woes, though Joe Gelhardt's stunning volley five minutes from time did at least give them some hope, but there was to be no repeat of the dramatic Leeds fightback.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs QPR as Harry Vaughan shines in poor defeat
arts.sum: Two quick-fire goals halfway through the second half from Kenneth Paal and Koki Saito proved crucial, and though Joe Gelhardt scored a terrific goal on his debut late on, there was to be no stirring comeback this time. Kept at it in the second and scored a wonderful goal to give City faint hope.

arts.ttl: Four in a row for QPR after win over Hull
arts.sum: Kenneth Paal and Koki Saito scored before Joe Gelhardt’s consolation.

arts.ttl: Hull v QPR line-ups: Kolli starts for Rangers, no Clarke-Salter
arts.sum: Rayan Kolli starts for QPR this evening. Kolli, who scored the winner at Plymouth after coming on as a substitute, comes in for Michael Frey – Rangers’ only change from the Argyle game. Jake Clarke-Salter is absent from the matchday squad. QPR: Nardi; Dunne, Edwards, Fox, Paal; Varane, Field, Morgan; Smyth, Chair; Kolli. arts.ttl: Hull City paying more for signing than first thought – Final agreement now in place
arts.sum: Hull City are set to pay €3.25m, plus a potential €500,000 In bonuses, to sign Eliot Matazo from AS Monaco this month. That’s according to journalist Sacha Tavolieri, who reports that Hull and Monaco have reached a final agreement for the 22-year-old midfielder. Hull City have moved for the midfielder over the past few days, The post Hull City paying more for signing than first thought – Final agreement now in place appeared first on Sport Witness.
